title: U.S. disposable personal income - monthly percentage of change 2019/20
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.
Month Jan '20 has the highest Monthly percentage of change and Oct '19 has the lowest Monthly percentage of change.
There is a difference of 0.6 between the maximum Month Jan '20 and minimum Month Oct '19.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.
The maximum Monthly percentage of change 0.6 is found at Month Jan '20 and the minimum is found at Oct '19 where Month is 0.0.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.

max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.
Month Jan '20 has the highest Monthly percentage of change and Oct '19 has the lowest Monthly percentage of change.
The highest value at Month Jan '20 is 60000000000.0x times more than the lowest value at Oct '19.
The Month Jan '20 has the highest Monthly percentage of change, followed by Aug '19, and Feb '19. Down to the Month Oct '19 which is the lowest.
Overall Monthly percentage of change has reduced over the Months.
Month Nov '19, Jun '19, Apr '19, and Mar '19 have the same Monthly percentage of change.
The Month Oct '19 has 1.73 times less Monthly percentage of change than average.
Summing up the values of all Months, we get total 4.5.
